Class Address

java.lang.Object
  business.Address

public class Address
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a real Address object

Used as a learning tool, just a few variables.

Constructor Detail

Address

public Address()
No param constuctor. Should initalize all references to avoid NullPointerException later. Allows primitive variables to get default values. Expects most instance variables to be populated by an update() method.

Method Detail

formatDisplay

public int formatDisplay(java.lang.StringBuffer temp)
In Order to test a class properly it is essential to be able to display the status of objects (ALL the data within the object).

Formats the contents of the object into a String so that when displayed (by the application) it will make a "pretty" display.

getData

public static int getData(java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                          useful.MyDataReader br,
                          java.lang.String sep)
                   throws java.io.IOException

This is the ORIGINAL version of getData(...) in the getData(...) method of all Business Classes.

Reads the prompts array in a loop. Gets data from the MyDataReader (param #2)and appends it to a StringBuffer (param #1). The appended data is in CSV format: 

 ~Field1~Field2~ ... Fieldn~
where '~' is a marker for the separator (param#3) ... note that for a particular business class the marker will NOT always be the same value. Provison must be made for the value to change depending on the location of the class within the overall structure of the business classes in a particular application (that is why the value of the separator must be passed as a parameter).

Throws:
java.io.IOException

update

public int update(java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
update() - inserts data from the StringBuffer, (param #1) into an empty object. The format of the StringBuffer is that provided by getData(...) in CSV format ... separator is first character of StringBuffer
